title: How does one get to a Riot Employee
body:
Alright so I have an idea for a Christmas {{champion:39}} Skin, but I cannot draw to save my life. I do not want to ask someone to draw it as they may take credit for the idea. I am wondering if there was any way to contact or be contacted by a Riot Employee that handles skin ideas and submit it that way. Otherwise I may have to contact an outside source and possibly the idea.

FireFoxe (NA Server)

replies.body: Posting ideas in Skins & Champion Concepts is a pretty good way to get noticed. As a concept artist on the skins team I am often trawling through to see what players are coming up with.

ever thought why is there not been a champion that turns into a werewolf or a champions that recovers health by mauling its fellow champions theres isnt one which is why there should be a champion that can sprint in a combat only way or be able to increase its teeth there is warwick but what if warwick was revamped like this were his ult is turning him into a werewolf with new abilities a bit like jayce and in another form he is a giant cyclops which isn't in the game currently and have him shoot lasers from his eyes whatever be honest these are champion idea's we don't have so comment bellow and share your views. who would want this idea

Since you took the time to reply to a players post I just have to ask.

Does it ever stress you guys out how much crap ends up about how much people hate everything or by now have you just kind of accepted that the internet is where people go to rage and you can never satisfy everyone? I know even I get pissed sometimes reading all the that comments and they aren't even directed at me.

Either way thanks for taking the time to respond to this guy and answer his question. Even if sometimes reddit and the forums act like riot does nothing for players, at least most know they do (or they just don't really care either way and just feel mild appreciation from time to time:P)

> Either way thanks for taking the time to respond to this guy and answer his question. Even if sometimes reddit and the forums act like riot does nothing for players, at least most know they do (or they just don't really care either way and just feel mild appreciation from time to time:P)

I'm going to be honest; yes of course it does! We care so much about players and we are players ourselves, so when people have concerns we often share them and can easily get really caught up in player reactions. When I feel something about our game and then I read people who feel the same I feel like I need to get up and do something about it right away, but that's not always productive. We always make sure we are getting context on decisions, understanding the problem spaces and trusting in each other first. It's so important for the health of the company that we make sure we have all the data and insights and trust before we go leading a crusade.

It can also be disappointing when people spread misinformation or just don't have the information to really understand what is happening. I have to be careful of how I word things on the boards because I don't want what I say to be misinterpreted or accidentally say something I don't intend to imply. I want to provide as much context as I can but sometimes I can't help as much as I'd like to. Sure I knew the Bildgewater event was coming and there would be some awesome lore soon, but I wasn't in a position to tell lore fans and assuage their frustration before the event. That's a difficult part of my job - being on the inside with all the information but also being a player and a part of the community.

When it comes to negative feedback I always try and find the positive in it by identifying the real problem underlying the frustration so we can address it. The way I see it players wouldn't bother posting if they didn't care a lot. I really appreciate that they obviously do!
